cluster_relations.rel_desc: The types of body language represent a categorization scheme applied to body language.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a categorization scheme or set of types used to classify instances or subtypes of the object concept.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Scope: conceptual taxonomy of body language forms

cluster_relations.rel_desc: A smile is listed as one of the facial expressions.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a more specific type or subtype within the category denoted by the object.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Frowns are categorized as facial expressions.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a more specific type or subtype within the category denoted by the object.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Raised eyebrows are treated as a type of facial expression.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a more specific type or subtype within the category denoted by the object.

args.justification: This relation links a set of types ('types of body language') to their base concept ('body language'), representing a taxonomic/categorization hierarchy rather than identity. Other similar relations in this chunk already use rel_cls_group = 'HIERARCHY', so aligning this one improves semantic consistency of taxonomy-like relations.
args.remark: Reclassified from IDENTITY to HIERARCHY to reflect that the subject is a taxonomy over the object concept, not the same identity.

executed_decisions.justification: This relation links a set of types ('types of body language') to their base concept ('body language'), representing a taxonomic/categorization hierarchy rather than identity.
